content: leaving a long tail approx 12 long and jmco cast on 5 round 15 k17 pick up the wrapped stitch as you pass it stitches bor is duck s tail k17 round 1 k5 round 16 k7 k2tog x3 k1 k2tog k1 round 2 * kfb * k1 k2tog k1 k2tog x3 k7 round 3 k10 now 26 sts / 13 per needle round 4 * k1 kfb * the next round has wrap and turns to add some shape to the duck s tail round 5 k15 round 17 k5 wt purl 10 wt this is 5 past bor round 6 * k2 kfb * k8 wt this is 3 past bor 20 sts purl 6 wt this is 3 past bor rearrange stitches so you have 10 stitches on each needle as k4 wt this is 1 past bor you work the next round purl 2 wt this is 1 past bor if you want a fluffier duck & are adding mohair add now k1 to bor round 7 k10 k10 round 18 k13 k13 pick up the wrapped stitches as you pass toy duck ahoy duckie page 3 of 4 round 19 k13 k13 cut your working yarn and mohair if using that about 12-14 long and clip it out of the way for now round 20 k1 k2tog x2 k7 placing the cardboard k7 k2tog k1 x2 now 22 sts / 11 per needle placing scrap yarn for picking up head stitches later take the cardboard and cut it into an oval shape a little bit bigger than the base of the duck you want the cardboard to stretch the base a little bit counting from the bor locate the last 4 stitches stitches 8-9-10-11 on the first needle and the first 4 stitches stitches 12-13-14-15 on second needle using 2 pieces of scrap yarn a thin slick yarn that will be easy to pull out later is best and a blunt tapestry needle thread a piece of scrap yarn through the 1st 4 stitches and place the cardboard another piece through the 2nd 4 stitches inside the duck using a very sharp tapestry needle and the cast on tail sew the cardboard into place so it makes a nice knot the scrap yarn so it doesn t come out while you are smooth base for the duck to sit on working the next round sewing in the cardboard base and closing the body with kitchener closing the body divide the stitches 11 on each needle using the held aside working yarn tail and a blunt tapestry needle close the round 21 work the scrap yarn stitches as normal body using kitchener stitch stuffing firmly as you go avoid k11 k11 your scrap yarn holding stitches as much as possible toy duck ahoy duckie page 4 of 4 working the head round 14 k10 starting at the end of the duck go through the 4 stitches held round 15 * k2tog * on waste yarn on
